abstracts.cdata!:
The First Structural Adjustment Credit
            Project provides US$15.0 million to support the
            Government's economic recovery program and allows
            economic activity to expand while current and future reform
            measures are implemented. The adjustment program focuses on
            economic liberalization measures and reform of public
            administration and public enterprises. The policy package
            includes exchange rate devaluation, monetary and fiscal
            policies including restructuring of the public investment
            program, decontrol of agricultural prices, simplification of
            tariff and customs procedures, liberalization of commercial
            practices, and an overhaul of the banking sector. The size
            of the public administration is to be reduced by some 15
            percent over the next 2 years. Technical assistance will be
            provided to strengthen economic management to permit
            implementation of the program and improve fiscal and
            monetary policy, public investment programming, external
            debt management and economic data collection and use.
